heading: Travel restrictions start
text: Updating guidelines over the next few days, the government advises against travel to China.

heading: First cases
text: First two cases of COVID-19 confirmed.

heading: Tom Moore
text: Tom Moore at 99 completes 100 laps of his garden.

heading: First vaccine trials
text: First European vaccine trials begin in Oxford.

heading: Past peak
text: Prime Minister Boris Johnson says the UK is "past the peak" of the COVID-19.

heading: Stay alert
text: The UK government updates their message to "stay alert".

heading: Some shops open
text: Changes of restrictions allowing the re-opening of garden centres, sports courts and recycling centres.

heading: Eat out
text: The "Eat out to Help Out" scheme begins. With a 50% discount on meals at indoor venues.

heading: Sharp rise of cases
text: Health Secretary Matt Hancock tells the House of Commons the "sharp rise" in COVID-19 cases is "concerning".

heading: 50,000 deaths
text: Uk becomes the fifth country to record 50,000 COVID-related deaths

heading: Cases over 70k
text: COVID-related deaths in the UK passes 70,000.

heading: First astraZeneca COVID vaccine
text: Brian Pinker, 82, becomes the first person in the country to receive the Oxford/AstraZeneca COVID vaccine.

heading: Over 2 million vaccined
text: Over 2.3 million people have now received a COVID vaccine.

heading: 100,000 deaths recorded
text: The Office for National Statistics said that the 100,000 UK deaths was surpassed in the week to 15 January.

heading: Half UK vaccinated
text: About half of the UK population have been vaccinated.

heading: Restrictions ease
text: COVID rules are eased in England, Scotland and Wales. Pubs and restaurants are permitted to re-open.

heading: Over 49 million vaccinated
text: The Uk passes a large milestone of 40 million people vaccinated.

heading: English restrictions lifted
text: England lifts all restrictions.

heading: Record cases
text: UK records over 51,870 COVID cases per day; for the first time since January 2021.

heading: 75% population vaccinated
text: The government figures showed that about 75% of the population have received two COVID vaccines.

heading: 3rd vaccine
text: Over 10 million people have recevied their 3rd dose of a vaccine.

heading: Omicron rises
text: Confirmed cases of Omicron exceeds 100.

heading: 82,000 COVID cases
text: Over 82,000 COVID cases were recorded in the UK, with over 12,000 identified as the Omicron variant.

heading: One in twenty
text: Figures suggest that 1 in 20 people had covid on New Year's Eve.
